laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT ABDOMEN AND PELVIS WITH CONTRAST

findings.spleen: Moderately enlarged measuring up to 13.9 cm, with normal attenuation.
findings.liver: Homogenous attenuation throughout, no evidence of focal lesions.
findings.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, no evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
findings.kidneys: Normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram, no focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
findings.diverticulosis: Present in the colon, with a segment of sigmoid colon demonstrating significant bowel wall thickening and inflammatory fat stranding.
findings.lymph nodes: No mesenteric lymphadenopathy; multiple prominent retroperitoneal lymph nodes likely reactive.
findings.other: No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion, normal prostate and seminal vesicles.
